column4: is there a way to virus scan a winXP partition when booting from an Xubuntu partition? e.g. with clam or something like that?
there are AV software for linux you can install that can scan windows machines.
on the same disk, different partition?
yes.. you can use it to scan anything you can access...
great, thanks, I'll try after installing xubuntu
you are using a dvi connection or vga?
DVI, and I have a DVI->VGA plug (which works)
I guess a new monitor will use DVI, no point in buying VGA anymore
i would dump any vga adaptors and so forth.. i find things/res detection work MUCH better without them
dump vga as fast as you can. :) I can think of only a few reasons to keep vga.
sure! but as I said, what I need, is to find supported resolutions, so I can buy a new monitor. the old one is broken
I imagine any new monitor can handle any res you can throw at it..  more of a mater of budget then anything else.
that sould be listed/mentioned on the nvidia specs  i would imagine..  I just get the highest res monitor i can afford.  most cards can do more then what my monitors can do anyway.
there is no driver issue. I just need to figure out what monitor to buy in the future. I don't want to buy a too large monitor, in case the chipset doesn't support it
it looks like I found my info here: http://www.intel.com/products/chipsets/gma950/index.htm
